title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. — On a night when the final score felt almost like a secondary detail, the basketball world bore witness to a performance for the ages. Glenn Robinson of the Milwaukee Bucks authored a breathtaking, Herculean effort, pouring in a staggering 49 points to single-handedly carry his team to a narrow 100-98 victory over the Charlotte Hornets.

From the opening tip, "The Big Dog" was on the hunt. Robinson was an unstoppable force, operating with a scorching efficiency that defied the Charlotte defense. He attacked the rim, hit from mid-range, and showcased a complete scoring arsenal that left the Hornets scrambling for answers all night. His 49-point outburst was not merely a high-volume affair; it was a masterclass in offensive dominance.

While Robinson’s historic night was the undeniable headline, the game’s conclusion provided a heart-pounding finale. With Robinson having shouldered the load for the first 47 minutes, the stage was set for a dramatic finish. The Bucks, clinging to a slim lead, turned to Ray Allen, whose 25 points provided the crucial secondary scoring Milwaukee desperately needed. Allen’s clutch free throws in the waning seconds ultimately sealed the two-point triumph.

The Hornets, led by Glen Rice’s 23 points, fought valiantly but had no counter for the Robinson onslaught. In the end, the final buzzer sounded on a 100-98 Bucks win, but the true story of the night was written in the scoring column. This was not just a game in the win column; it was the night Glenn Robinson delivered one of the most spectacular individual performances of the era, a 49-point symphony that will echo in the annals of franchise history.
